column4: hey I messed up my home folder somehow when I was making a new partition to mount there, and now I can't make new users, can you help me figure out what's going on?
the thing is I accidentally interrupted the mv, so some folders got deleted, so I needed to recreate some other accounts
well you may not be able to make new users since /home doesn't exist or you dont have permissions to it
It exists, and I checked the permissions with the file browser, and they point to root
pastebin the results of "ls -al" under /
and also the ones of "ls -al" under /home
I don't see any in / or /home
you don't see any of what?
the results of ls -al seem to be the contents of my homefolder, "~/"
um errrrr... ok post the results of "ls -al" in /, and then post the results of "ls -al" under /home  and i'll see what's up
oh sorry, I get it now. First cd to the directory, then run "ls -al"?
correct
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/9732/
so what happens when you try to create a new user?  and how are you craeting a new user?
I use the system>admin>users and groups application, and it acts like it made a new user, but the new user can't log in, and they don't get a folder in /home
did you check the pastebin
oops sorry sorta forgot
yeah it looked fine to me..have you tried "adduser"?
- no, haven't
sudo adduser --shell /bin/bash --home /home/myuser myuser
any luck?
